p: In Figure 3A is shown the amplitude of the interaction between ethanol concentration (X 1) and extraction time (X 2) regarding the extraction yield. Increasing percentages of ethanol from 60 to 80% with extraction time from 30 to 45 min enhanced the extraction yield. It can be seen in Figure 3B that by varying the ethanol concentration from 60 to 80% and increasing the solvent-to-material ratio from 10 to 30 mL/g, the extraction yield of target compounds was improved. Figure 3C presents the correlation between extraction time and the solvent-to-material ratio. It was found that the maximum yield (17.50%) was achieved when the extraction time was 45 min and the solvent-to-material ratio was 20 mL/g. This result was in accordance with the findings of previous studies [ 31, 32].
